trans-unit.target: TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_000<tab>Hello! Enjoying the festivities, are you? If you have any questions regarding the Starlight Celebration, please don't hesitate to ask!
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_Q1_000_001<tab>What will you ask?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_001<tab>What's with all the red tunics?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_002<tab>What is the Starlight Celebration?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_003<tab>What is a fallen star?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_004<tab>What is a Starlight sentinel?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_005<tab>What is a Starlight tunic?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_A1_000_006<tab>Nothing.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_010<tab>My scarlet-clad colleagues and I have been charged by the Adventurers' Guild with running this year's Starlight Celebration. The festival spans the entire realm of Eorzea, and we have little helpers stationed in the cities of Gridania, Limsa Lominsa, and Ul'dah.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_011<tab>If you are inquiring as to the specifics of our duties, well, I shall be happy to explain those as well. It all starts with the children, who compose a special letter to the goddess Nymeia, the Spinner, and place it under the boughs of a Starlight sentinel.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_012<tab>A little helper, dressed in seasonal garb, will then collect a youngling's message, and personally deliver a present to the eagerly awaiting child.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_013<tab>This joyous task is simply an extension of the charitable activities performed all year round by our celebrant and festival supervisor, Amh Garanjy.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_020<tab>The Starlight Celebration can be traced back to ancient Ishgard. Long ago, a terrible battle claimed countless lives, leaving thousands of children orphaned in the harsh cold weather of Coerthas.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_021<tab>Unable to bear their suffering, Ishgardian knights would offer these children board and lodging within their barracks. Of course, this was expressly forbidden, but the knights devised a plan to sneak them in, disguising the children in jackets of their scarlet uniforms.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_022<tab>Owing to their generosity, the children survived the winter and lived to pay forward the kindness they had received. The former orphans would adorn themselves in scarlet uniforms, delivering gifts to children on the coldest week of the year. Thus, the Starlight Celebration was born.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_023<tab>Over the years, the celebration has undergone gradual changes. The snowy-bearded captain of the kind-hearted knights has become known as the “Saint of Nymeia,” and children believe that he delivers their hopes and prayers directly to the goddess Herself.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_024<tab>Similarly, his red-jacketed knights have become the “saint's little helpers.” They are particularly beloved by the younglings, for it is their role to bring gifts to every child who sends a prayer to the Spinner.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_030<tab>Fallen stars are tokens of appreciation given to those who contribute their time and effort to the running of the Starlight Celebration.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_031<tab>These tokens can be exchanged at a mammet dispensator for a range of seasonal merchandise.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_100_031<tab>There are, however, several types of fallen stars you might receive. Visit a mammet interchanger should you wish to exchange one type of fallen star for another.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_032<tab>Fallen stars are received as rewards for completing the daily quests available in each residential district.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_033<tab>The type of fallen star you receive upon completion of the quest will change depending on the location from which you collected a child's letter to the Spinner.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_034<tab>Letters obtained from a star-topped Starlight sentinel will reward you with a yellow fallen star.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_035<tab>Letters obtained from a moon-topped Starlight sentinel will reward you with a blue fallen star.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_036<tab>Letters obtained from a sun-topped Starlight sentinel will reward you with a red fallen star.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_037<tab>Letters obtained from a standard Starlight sentinel will reward you with a green fallen star.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_040<tab>“Starlight sentinel” is the name given to a tree decorated for the purpose of the Starlight Celebration.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_041<tab>Initially, we had planned for the younglings to leave their letters only under the festive trees that we little helpers set up...
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_042<tab>...But it seems the sentinels available from the mammet dispensators have proven popular receptacles for the children's seasonal messages.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_043<tab>Starlight sentinels placed within an estate's gardens during the Starlight Celebration will become objectives for the respective district's daily quest.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_044<tab>There are three outdoor furnishing items that meet this criteria: star<var 1F /var>topped Starlight sentinels, moon<var 1F /var>topped Starlight sentinels, and sun<var 1F /var>topped Starlight sentinels.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_050<tab>A Starlight tunic is the costume we require those contributing to the celebrations to wear─a little helper's uniform, if you will.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_GUIDEXMS2014_000_051<tab>If you happen to misplace your tunic during the frantic festivities, then simply ask me for a replacement. Thanks to our mysterious benefactor, we've boxes and boxes of the things!
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_052<tab>Certain steps of the Starlight Celebration seasonal quests can only be completed while wearing a Starlight tunic.
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_053<tab>Should you lose your Starlight tunic and find yourself unable to progress in a quest, speak with the Starlight Celebration crier to obtain a replacement.

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_DRIDANIAXMS2014_000_060<tab>It is truly wonderful to see so many folk embracing the spirit of the Starlight Celebration, but I only wish we had more little helpers to assist with our various festive duties. As things stand, I fear some few younglings may not receive their gifts before the festival ends...
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_DRIDANIAXMS2014_000_080<tab>Thank you again, little helper! Another day, another joyous smile!

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_LIMSAXMS2014_000_090<tab>Wivout more 'ands on deck, this festival's bloody doomed, it is! If one o' them scamps starts weepin', then <var 1A 02 /var>I'll<var 1A 01 /var> start weepin', and we'll all be bleedin' drowned in a sea o' tears!
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_LIMSAXMS2014_000_110<tab>Ye've 'elped steer the celebration back on course, ye 'ave. It ain't over just yet, though, so keep yer bloody good self 'andy, ye hear?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_ULDAHXMS2014_000_120<tab><sigh> I have a million and one things to do, and but two hands to do them. Hm? What is it? Can't you see I'm occupied with running a festival here?

TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_ULDAHXMS2014_000_140<tab>I had begun to regret the decision to volunteer my services for the celebration, but the brilliant smiles of the children are like a balm for the soul. You understand that feeling, too, don't you, adventurer?
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_DRIDANIAXMS2014_000_070<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_071<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_LIMSAXMS2014_000_100<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_101<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_ULDAHXMS2014_000_130<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
TEXT_FESXMS2014_00222_SYSTEM_000_131<tab>（★未使用／削除予定★）
